column4: hey guys, whats a good media stream broadcasting program? anything compatible w/ shoutcast?
thanks, dude, i'll check it out, peace
it's a linux kernel that's compiled for modern processors, both single-core and multi-core. that's why. the -386 version is made to run on 386 processors and so on.
symmetric multi processing, support for more than one core
I have a quadcore, should i check that out?
the -generic kernel is installed by default unless you do something to change it
the server kernel image optimizes your quad-core performance just as much as the -generic kernel, really.
it was suggested, in that it optimized the communication between the hardware and the kernel
the "generic" kernel does that too. why would anyone disable such a feature?
you don't. it's not disabled. really.
the generic kernel is on the distro CD's so that it has a broader compatibility range
myself having a x86/64bit  quadcore setup, would it not be more beneficial? my question is, will that affect x or kde?

neither the -server or the -generic will assume a quad-core system. they both will detect your type of processor and support and adjust too it. the -server kernel is SLOWER for desktop use and will make kde slower to focus on the network server tasks.

how many times must i answer your question before you trust me? Ubuntu does NOT try to make your computer slower by installing the -generic kernel. REALLY. the -server kernel will run slower on your desktop computer. instead it wil focus on server tasks, as serving web pages.
